Matthew,

I'm going to see Rational this afternoon in Lausanne with exactly the same
concern as you.

I will keep you update with the information I'll get from them.

Cheers,

Marc

"Matt Sinclair" <matthew.sinclair@...> on 07.03.2001 07:35:26

Please respond to junit@yahoogroups.com

To:   junit@yahoogroups.com
cc:

Subject:  [junit] JUnit vs Rational Quality Architect


As a huge fan of unit testing and recent convert to JUnit (I have
used similar tecniques in both C++ and Java for years) I have heard
mutterings within my organization about the possible use of a product
from Rational called "Quality Architect".

I have never been a big fan of the Big Process approach to software
engineering and have never been able to really get my teams or
myself really enthused about using tools like Rose.

I am wondering if anyone one in the group has had experience with the
product (Quality Architect) or would have any comments on its use?

I am pretty much familiar with the philosophy and practice of JUnit,
so I would be interested in how QA compares with JUnit and what it
gives on top of that (if anything).

Any comments would be much appreciated.

Cheers,
M@
